comment: This class is a LOT of work. Be prepared to spend some serious time studying for Dr. J's exams. She is a very nice and sweet lady, but her exams were extremely hard; it almost seemed as if you needed to memorize her lectures word by word. There were 5 exams in this class. You are allowed a note card for chapter tests and a full page for the final.

Nice professor, homework are questions in the online Macmillan textbook, lots of questions but doesn't take long to finish. You get a notecard for the exams but don't rely on them, the class usually averages around the 60's. iClicker is used as attendance, but you just have to reach a certain amount of points so it's ok if you miss a few classes.

She was really nice, but her tests were IMPOSSIBLE. I would study weeks in advance, read the textbook, do the homework, go to almost every lecture, SI sessions, and reread over the powerpoints, and I would still fail almost every test. There's still hope, some people were getting A's, but the class average for the exams were 60's.

Anisa was a very kind person. She was always willing to help outside of class and she is quick to respond to emails.Yes, the tests are hard but its mostly the course itself. You should not take this class thinking its an easy A. I studied extremely hard and I still didn't do the best. She was a really good teacher though!
She's nice and all but group projects brought my grade down. The tests are horrible. Thats all I have to say. I studied hella

She's a really sweet person but her tests are BRUTAL. The averages were always around the 40-50 range. There was one extra credit assignment EVER and it was the like 5 extra points. She does not curve, there are no test retakes, and honestly do not take this class thinking its going to be an easy A. I would study for 15+ hours and still fail.

Dr. J is definitely the best professor I've had at KSU. Her lectures are very clear and informative. She makes everything you need to know for the test clear. Please sit close to the front row so you can get to know her. She is very generous and extremely helpful and quick at responding to emails. Do the study guide each unit and you'll do great.

She is a great lecturer who clearly lays out what you will be expected to know on the tests. The tests are difficult, but read the textbook and fill out the "study guide" and you should get at least a B. Group projects before every test, not too difficult. She does offer 25ish bonus points which are very helpful. Put in the work and you'll do well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Jahangiri is very nice but is awful when it comes to helping her students. She copy and pastes the material from Dr. K, and offers no additional help or resources beyond that. She is VERY harsh in terms of grading. I've felt lost in this class and spend 15+ hours a week on the material. Do not take her if you are someone that needs 1 on 1 help

Shes really nice but SHE TAKES ATTENDANCE EVER CLASS WITH AN ICLICKER THAT HAS UR LOCATION. its a part of ur grade too and the tests arent anything like the powerpoints and we told her that and she said its just how the tests arent anything is. tests are on paper with a notecard. multiple group projects too

She is a nice professor but I didn't take bio 1 because I had bio 2 in a block and if you don't know bio 1 it is very very difficult for you to understand it. she doesn't help outside of class. the tests are all application based so if you don't know the material you won't do good In this class. a lot of group work and assignments.

Sweet lady who listens to her students, but definitely a hard class in general. Lectures were okay but you'll have to use the textbook for full understanding since tests are application based. Attendance is also mandatory. She truly does want her students to succeed and will help outside of class, but you have to put in the work if you want an A.

Please do not take her. She is honestly one of the nicest professors and has a huge heart but is genuinely not a good teacher. Her lectures never correlate with the tests, and the study guides she gives you never align with the test material. You can use a note card for the test, but it never helps because the tests are extremely difficult.
Good class, it was just very difficult especially considering the fact that I was a freshman taking 1108 before 1107.

So I took 1108L over the summer. AND IT WAS INTENSE. But Anisa honestly shocked me with how invested she was. She would email you like you would typically text someone, super fast, super specific, would look at your work and give you feedback. She would go back and forth with me on email for a few hours a couple days a week. She's so patient!!!!!!

She cares so much about her students. She did everything she could to make sure we understood. She required attendance through answering polls during lectures but there are many opportunities to get the credit. Also her exams are application heavy questions. If you arent prepared to study and complete your work on time then don't choose Dr J.
I took her lab online kind of time consuming because there is multiple parts to each lab a week. If you put in the effort it should be an A or B tbh just beware of the amount of work.

I loved this professor, her lectures were very palpable even though there was so much content to go through. The tests are application based so studying the day before the test and just trying to memorize vocab words will not get you far. She tries to make it interesting and she genuinely cares for her students. Beware of group projects though.

Easy class but you have to put in work. We have like 20 homework each for pre and post lectures but only the top 10 are graded so you dont have to do the rest. 5 ez online quizzes. Tests are application based but if you study the notes and know how to apply the material rather than just memorizing youll be fine. Allows a notecard per each unit exam

This class is what you make of it. If you study well, and do the assigned work you'll do well. She's a great professor, her slides and lectures are always really helpful and organized well for the exams. Its a lot of content covered, and some of the questions can be tricky but the exams aren't hard if you study.
kind of read off the slides for lectures. assigned groups for the whole semester which was a little annoying. very kind and lenient!

She is very good in lecture, her slides are great so I didnt read the textbook. You can tell she loves what she teachers. Answered emails quick, Strict rules/deadlines. Group work affects grade, which sucks if your group is bad. Test are very bad, unclear and difficult wording but the whole department writes them so not her fault.
All tests were application based and worded strangely. Lots of homework to keep up with but overall a nice professor

STAY AWAY! Her exams are in person and paper which are all application based. She fr said it doesn't matter how hard you study the material she gives you because "you just have to know it". If you're an average student who uses online resources to help you get through quizzes and exams ;), this isn't the professor for you. She's disorganized too...

Dr. J is really nice and a great teacher, but this class could be better. You get placed in randomized group where you do a group assignment weekly, and the class is very lecture heavy. There is a Pearson homework due before and each chapter. Overall, I would take this class again, but I wish I knew what it would be like before I signed up.

Dr. Jahangiri is a wonderful professor and such a lovely person. Her lectures are always interesting and the tests and quizzes keep you sharp. She emphasizes actually understanding the material and not simply memorization, which is shown in the exams. Lots of Pearson homework, but it directly relates to the lectures. Very reasonable with due dates.

Professor J cares very deeply for her students. However, she randomizes groups so you do group work all semester long which can be annoying. Her lectures are not in depth so be prepared to read outside of class. If you weren't an AP student in highschool and struggle with application based tests take someone else! 1108 is a much diff than 1107!

I had her for the BIO1108 lecture and she was great. She is a little quiet but she really cares about her students. The material is difficult on its own and her lectures are okay so just prepare to work outside of class. She offers extra credit and learning catalytic's bonus days. You have to come to class for the participation grade.

She is amazing and the nicest professor I've every had throughout my college experience! If you have a chance take her class. Biology is no walk in the park, but she helps as much as she can to make it less stressful and wants you succeed in her class. Test were not easy so make sure you study, and understand the concept because she give scenarios.

Dr J was definitely a nice teacher. she always responded to emails and even held a study session before the final on her own time. she loves biology and her passion for the subject usually kept me awake during her class. she is fair and really wants her students to succeed. Def take her.

Dr. Jahangiri is the best professor Ive taken a class with so far. Shes very friendly and obviously cares about her field and subject matter. She asked for feedback throughout the semester and was very willing to change her routine and class plans based on what we said we needed more help with, etc.

I love Dr. J. She's funny, there for you, and she wants you to succeed! She doesn't pull punches on her test but gives you bonus questions. She's so freaking nice. Seriously, she might actually be made out of sucrose. Take her! But don't give her a hard time, work for your grade!

Incredibly sweet person, but also not a push over.  Tests are not easy, but she is well organized and provides very good  lecture notes.  She is excited about biology and it makes the class more interesting.

Excellent professor! Kind, funny, easy-going, and passionate about biology! The book is unnecessary because she is so thorough in lectures and all her powerpoints and a review guide are posted on D2L. Attendance is 5% of the grade.

This professor is so sweet. Her class is relatively easy when compared to other biology courses. She is very easy to communicate with. Her test consist of matching, multiple choice, and short answer questions. She post power points that have all test topics and makes study guides. She is extremely thorough and easy if you put time in to study.
Professor is very knowledgeable and nice. her tests are right off the power points she uses in lectures. gives plenty of extra credit opportunities. strongly recommend her!
